Paper.Title: Sydney, July 2006. c(c)2006 Association for Computational Linguistics Semi-Supervised Training for Statistical Word Alignment

Section.Paragraph: We introduce a semi-supervised approach to training for statistical machine translation that alternates the traditional Expectation Maximization step that is applied on a large training corpus with a discriminative step aimed at increasing word-alignment quality on a small, manually word-aligned sub-corpus. We show that our algorithm leads not only to improved alignments but also to machine translation outputs of higher quality.
